Annual fee waiver – the Business credit card is free for the first year. If you spend £6,000 or more in the first year and each year thereafter, we’ll waive the annual fee in the year after you meet the spend criteria.

column32:
•A Business Credit Card to help making and keeping track of payments simple for business customers.  It can be used to help customers manage their cash flow whilst keeping their business expenses separate from personal spending.

•Available to new and existing Business Banking customers with annual turnover under £2m. 

•Customer must hold and maintain a business bank account in the same legal entity name with NatWest/RBS.
column45: The card is free for the first year. If a cardholder spends £6,000 or more each year thereafter we will waive the annual fee every year the cardholder meet that criteria.
column50:
Payments to the Card will not reduce the balance until the payment has cleared. The monthly statement includes information about how long it takes for payments to clear.
We use any payments we receive to pay off:
• any overdue amounts from previous monthly
statements;
• any minimum payment; and
• any overlimit amount on the Card.
Customers can’t choose how a payment is applied to their Card. We apply any payments made in the following order:
• to reduce sums shown on the most recent monthly statement, according to their interest rates, with the highest rate paid first; and
• if any payment exceeds the most recent monthly statement balance, the excess will then be applied to reduce sums charged to the Card but not yet shown on any monthly statement. This is also done according to interest rates, with the highest interest rate paid first. If parts of either of the balances referred to above have the same interest rate, sums on which interest is charged on interest will reduce first.
We may give written notice allowing the customer not to make a minimum payment. If so, interest will still accrue.
column51:
We’ll issue a monthly statement showing all amounts charged to the Card since the previous monthly statement and the Card balance. The whole balance or part of it can be paid , but at least the minimum amount on your monthly statement must be paid by the payment date. A monthly statement will explain how to make payments.
We may not issue a monthly statement if the balance is zero and there have been no entries since the previous monthly statement.
The minimum payment must be made each month from a business account in the customers' name.
The minimum payment will be the greater of:
(i) £5 or the full balance if less; or
(ii) that month’s interest, any Default Charges, 1/12th of any annual fee and 3% of the remaining balance (excluding any annual fee).

Any overdue amounts, which will be included in the total amount required to pay, are payable immediately. When we ask, immediate payment is required on any amount you owe over the  Business Credit Limit.
We encourage customers to pay more than the minimum amount each month. As they will clear their balance more quickly and pay less interest. 
Customers must not make payments to their Card that creates a positive balance on your account. We may return any credit balance or apply it to a current account..

column14: Minimum payment will be the greater of (i) £5 or the full balance if less; or (ii) that month's interest, any Default Charges, 1/12th of any annual fee and 3% of the remaining balance (excluding any annual fee).
Up to 56 days' interest free on purchases if balance paid in full and on time. For cash transactions interest is charged from the date the transaction is applied to the account.
